jchain.util

Class MerkleTree<T extends Hashable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jchain.util.MerkleTree<T>

  • public class MerkleTree<T extends Hashable>
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a generic MerkleTree structure that generates root hashes for use in cryptographic operations. I do not provide much documentation in this class as it is a dummy class. All the work is done in the MerkleNode class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MerkleTree()
      Returns an instance of an EMPTY MerkleTree.
      MerkleTree(java.util.Collection<T> hashableList)
      Return an instance of a MerkleTree containing all of the transactions in the given collection.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Computes the root hash of the MerkleTree.
      boolean contains(java.lang.String hash)
      Determines whether the tree contains a hashable with the specified transaction hash.
      int count()
      Gets the number of items stored in the tree.
      T get(java.lang.String hash)
      Attempts to retrieve a hashable from the tree using the indicated hash.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the MerkleTree.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(T hashable)
        Adds an object implementing the Hashable interface to the MerkleTree.
        Parameters:
        hashable - A hashable object.

      • computeHash

        public java.lang.String computeHash()
        Computes the root hash of the MerkleTree.
        Returns:
        A SHA-256 double hash hexstring representing the Merkle root hash.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String hash)
        Determines whether the tree contains a hashable with the specified transaction hash.
        Parameters:
        hash - A SHA-256 double hash hextstring.
        Returns:
        True if the tree contains a hashable with the indicated hash, false otherwise.

      • count

        public int count()
        Gets the number of items stored in the tree.
        Returns:
        The number of items in the tree.

      • get

        public T get(java.lang.String hash)
        Attempts to retrieve a hashable from the tree using the indicated hash.
        Parameters:
        hash - A SHA-256 double hash hexstring.
        Returns:
        A hashable if one can be found with the given hash, null otherwise.

        Returns a string representation of the MerkleTree.
